review: Einfaches Spielprinzip und maximaler SpaÃŸ. Eine Basis gegen AuÃŸerirdische verteidigen und mit fortschreitendem Spiel immer neue Technologien erforschen, um der Unzahl an Alien Herr zu werden. Einfach herrlich!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002391261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
Hohoho! I had this game from a Humble Indie Bundle and never did try it until I saw it was up for an Xmas Winter Achievement (2011), so I played it. And you know what, it's great. Face off against waves of enemy titans and build up your defences in order to protect your base. It's like the usual RTS game in which you need to build refineries in order to save up money and then place turrets slowly along the path the titans take to reach your base. It's really great, I loved it. It's very retro with it's 16bit visuals but when the pace gets going it really does get hectic. If you're still not sure, check out some gameplay on YouTube or something, but I'd recommend it.

WHY ELSE WOULD I BE WRITING HERE... well... no that doesn't make sense. A recommendation should be something positive as you want others to buy I do have other recommendations that are negative. Lol, counter-intuitive? Bleh. I should go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989117548', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1474, 'last_played': 1428070639}
review:
This game is not for the casual player. this game be quite hard and the element that what you end with as currency in a level is the amount you start the next one can cause alot of frustration. another thing is that the Titans actually Learn later on. the more intelligent titans will actually start to try to walk around your defenses or even concentrate to get your more powerfull defenses. luckily you get many tools like drone factories,heavy weapons, and even some tactical tools like a scarecrow and the decoy to controll the flow of titans. but beware for the ones that are more determined.

this game can be very challenging sometimes and the research tree is kinda of a trial and error thing, but it only makes the game even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972269714', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1425166945}
review:
Big fan of Tower Defense style games, and a sucker for the the retro gaming art style. 

The game mechanics are tough. I still don't feel that I've completely mastered them despite finishing the game with 100% achievements. I find Defense Grid a more enjoyable title overall, perhaps simply because I feel I better understand it and feel like I can grasp the winning strategies involved. 

Revenge of the Titans can be frantic at times, but that's why it's a little bit special. Perhaps part of it is accepting that you will lose towers.

Revenge of the Titans is a worthwhile title if you can pick it up on special, but far from essential. A light recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000422381', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1379553376}
review:
This game is an interesting one for me.  I enjoy a lot of aspects of it, but it can be frustrating in many ways too.  Defends your base against hordes of monsters, research 1 new tech every stage for 30+ stages, and try to earn money by mining crystals during each round.

Problem is the game gets HARDER the more money, resources, and powerups you stockpile.  I've experienced weird reactive AI where the game seemingly punishes certain turret placement because of a system of perceived threat -- Enemies will skirt your turret range and go around you!  Building vertically is superior to horizontal, so some maps are just frustrating to build on.  It ends up feeling like a race against the impossible as things get harder, so you must do better, but by doing so things get harder still.  That being said, I've never beaten the game because a recent patch broke my old save I think, so I had to start over.  I don't know how the end half of the game goes.

Good aesthetics and music too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982210220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1378882798}
review:
Revenge of the Titans: It's just not fun. The interface seems designed to be intentionally annoying. Contrived gameplay issues overcome the fun animations and cute tongue-in-cheek storyline.

For example: It seems to be an intentional design choice that the playing map is just a tad larger than your screen size, no matter what resolution. With invaders coming from all sides, you have to roll the edge of the map left, right, up, and down to follow the action on each side of the map. So watching the action on one side of the map means, by definition, that you can't watch action on the other side. It's just a bad design choice to make the game artifically more difficult. A difficulty gimmick, if you will.

Annoyed and done after about 2 hours. Thought I'd like this more, but... oh well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978810807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1419397613}

Will you build automated droids? or wil you choose instead to go with giant shotguns of death? How my times will u play a level till your satisfied that you have all the money u can get from it? i say you should find out! Oh one of the 2 creators real name: Caspian Prince. ^_^

review: Revenge of the Titans may be your typical castle dfense game but its actually alot of fun.  You can upgrade your turrets or whatever equipment you use through research and defens certain parts of the solar system starting with Earth. Its a great retro like game from an indie studio but the price for this game is a bit overpirced. Its $15. Should be at least $5. However, I got this off the humble indie bundle. Try to get this game as cheap as possible instead of the current steam price ($15)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998093669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1377376778}
review:
Three-eyed-cat killing fun! Well thought out and difficult game with it's roots firmly in the tower defence genre. Ranging from wide open spaces with attackers from all angles, to choke points so tight you can't build fast enough. It's not boring - but it is hard.

Cute graphics and a retro soundtrack to boot. If you're looking for the next level up from your tower defence games, give this a try. No matter how good you are, this WILL give you a run for your money.

Ishy

author: {'steamid': '76561198018924290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1375816570}
review:
An intensely fun non-linear tower defense game.

Save Humanity by chasing away Titans from Earth, then cleansing them from their own home planets, Humane style: Proximity Mines, Machine Guns, Lasers, Rockets, Nanobots, Nukes, your choice!

The graphics are superb, the titans are amazingly cute, the dialogues are very funny, the sound effects are awesome, the technology tree is immensely varied, and the game offers tons of fun and freedom in terms of strategy to employ to beat the titans.

Unfortunately, the game difficulty is not perfectly well balanced. Depending on how you previously performed and of your choice of technology investments, you might get stuck at some later point in the game. Despite this rather annoying problem, this game is a must play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960531791', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1510774747}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993403605', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1345100400}
review: Call me a sucker for RPGs, Tower Defense games and 8-bit sprites but Revenge of the Titans is a great action/strategy game that you should take note of. While early levels seem easy-going for casual players the intensity ramps up as the game demands for your attention as meaningful upgrades and strategy become a major factor in this self-realized little nugget of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035717993', 'num_games_owned': 2052, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 2990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2848, 'last_played': 1562490824}
review:
Some hardcore shit - i got around 80% of the way through, and to get that far, i had to go back to around 60% of the way through and try again - because this games actually has rewards for playing well that carry across between levels.

Although technically a casual game, there not much casual about this - if youre not careful, and clever, not to mention efficient, this fucking Titans will PWN you good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002599069', 'num_games_owned': 1261, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1378872616}
review:
Got this nice little gem during the second Humble Indie Bundle and the guys who made it deserve every bit of my donation! This game is mainly of the tower and defense genre where you must fight waves of aliens of varying strengths and abilities. Don't worry though, you have a MASSIVE arsenal at your disposal. The tech tree in this game is pretty big; there are plenty of weapons and upgrades in the game to suit your style of tower and defense strategy. There are power ups that can be used during the game as well to change the tide of battle like freezing enemies, nuking them, stimpacking your turrets, etc.

Overall, this game is highly polished. The presentation I believe is flawless because I enjoy the pseudo 8-bit style. The controls are easy to grasp and there are of course hotkeys to quickly build your defenses. The campaign is a good length and the game is just enough difficult to keep me from snoozing. There are achievements in-game too, but I wish there were Steam achievements!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1375862251}
review:
Clean graphics, and it has a style of its own. I like it. It's pretty much a tower defense title, except that you earn money to buy and upgrade things like buildings and money AFTER you finish the mission. Everything you buy will then be available in the next mission(s). Since the enemies walk around all over the map and they don't follow a certain path, it's more a tower spamming game. You just place towers all over the place (well, as long as you have the money), and most of them will do their job perfect. I'm missing the strategy part here, which is a real shame. Other than that, it's worth a try, just not for the full price. Get it when it's discounted (â‚¬5 or less).

author: {'steamid': '76561197977278278', 'num_games_owned': 963, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3345, 'last_played': 1388627373}
review: This came with the Indie Humble Bundle 2, I believe.  It's a Tower Defense game in name and some of the game play elements but it goes far beyond that. The enemies don't follow any predetermined path to get to you. There are tech trees for you to build up your defenses and you must give some thought to which you choose because you can only choose one per mission. Money carries over from one mission to the next. Making deciding what to actually buy during a map something that will give you pause in thought. The mission maps are all also randomly generated (I think). All and all a super game for the price ( would say its worth about $5-$10). But a good amount of people probably already own it due to the Humble Bundle. Don't let the simplistic graphics and the 8-bit sounds fool you. This is a great game. Give it at least 5 missions before passing judgment. If you like Tower Defense, you will love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963942135', 'num_games_owned': 2334, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1329465600}
review: Neat, addicting game -- actually really, really challening in some spots on the hardest difficulty.  I don't know if I agree with the tagline that this is a mix of RTS and tower defense -- it feels more like straight up tower defense to me, and there's not really even that much of a twist on the formula, to be honest, but it is really, really fun, really well done, and the technology upgrade path is compelling, doesn't seen to pigeon-hole you into a specific path, and leaves a lot of room for experimentation.  There's no single way to win a map, and that's the thing I like the most.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989169398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1399862748}
review:
Very fun game, its like a tower defense kind of style to it, and you upgrade, obtain new towers through each battle. I literally spend around 10 minutes after each battle trying to figure what to advance in tech or get a tower. The money you obtain with battles fallow throughout the whole singleplayer; adds a new twist to not going crazy and thinking of where towers are needed most. And another interesting idea, is that often the titans will take the roads, but they are not dependant on them (as in they will go around). They are pretty much trying to make it to your base asap. taking the roads makes them a bit faster. I have not thoroughly finished singleplayer yet, but I generally got the idea of this game. Very nice for some casual gameplay or roadtrips. And has a survival and endless.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197962719077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 86400}
review: I have only played endless mode so far, it's not like a traditioinal turret defense. Instead endless being on a single map with endless amounts of enemy waves, the map changes for each level. Every level has a different are where the enemy attacks from so it at least keeps you on your toes. It gains an RTS aspect because money is your currency and you can throw down refineries to help gain extra $$ in a game. The money carries over into the next round. All pixel graphics... I'd wait until its under $10 to buy, I just say RTS/TD and had to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012728744', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1320390000}
review: I usually hate tower defense games, but this one is just different enough to be worth a look. Researching weapons and gaining manual control over your towers adds an RTS feel to it, and it looks fantastic. The downside is that it's very easy to screw up your research or spend too much cash and be crippled in later levels, but with some experimentation it's simple to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971186866', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1403391672}
review:
Tough but fun.

A retro styled tower defence game. Each map has you mining minerals and fending off the invaders. Any spare cash you have afterwards goes towards funding the next mission. There is a tech tree to research, one upgrade per mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993725466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1652463836}
review:
Where to begin... the amazing art direction? The challenging, fast-paced gameplay? The fact that it is finally on Steam? 

Revenge of the Titans is an amazing blend of RTS and Tower defense genres, simple to understand, hard to master, beautiful to behold, complete with that great feeling when you finally complete a diabolically hard mission.

Constantly juggling between managing your resources, placing new turrets in optimal configurations, manually reloading and picking powerups, and selling unneeded stuff can be pretty hectic and pretty entertaining.

The singleplayer campaign has a bunch of stuff you can research in between missions, making you choose between different playing styles- a lot of weak but cheap turrets? Or a few powerful ones? What enhancements do you want to build? Will you research those heavy blasters immediately or invest into a longer research that will pay off in the long run?

All in all, a great RTS/Tower defense hybrid game- I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978782696', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1450763305}
review:
A crossfire of planetary invasions, caffeine infused scientists, legions of robots, and a pounding opera of Gustav Holst's "Mars" masterpiece. All backed up by a glorious 8 bit inspired visual feast which plunges you straight into the insane universe of Revenge of the Titans.

This game has all the right stuff and is overflowing with perfection. I was glued to the screen until the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006437466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1383840826}
review:
I love this game! I bought it AGAIN on steam just for the convenience, and it gives me a chance to support some very talented people. More please guys!

The game is baisically a well presented form of tower defence, but with a pleasing twist of continuity and decision making - you can only reasearch one new thing at a time, and it's up to you what you concentrate on: do you head right for explosives to do max damage? or maybe improve your mining tech to gather more money in the earlier stages? (money is carried over from level to level, so efficiency is important)

Thankfully the game warns you when a certain kind of tech is going to be important, so you don't end up stuck in an impossible situation. If things get too bad you can always go back to replay a previous level and do it better - giving you more to play with further down the line.

I know this isn't everyones thing, but if you are looking for a very well made game that requires a little tactical nous - this is a good bet.
